revision.text:
{{Infobox person |office = |term_start = |term_end = | name = Hikaru Saeki |native_name = 佐伯光 |native_name_lang = jpn | nickname = | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1943|04|03}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | home_town = | nationality ={{JPN}} | alma_mater =[[Nippon Medical School]] | spouse = Seiji Saeki | children = | parents = | relatives = | module = {{Infobox military person|embed=yes | branch = {{flagicon image|Naval Ensign of Japan.svg}} [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]] | serviceyears = 1989 - 2003 | unit = | rank =[[File:JMSDF Rear Admiral insignia (b).svg|17px]] [[Rear Admiral]] }} }} {{nihongo|'''Hikaru Saeki'''|佐伯 光|Saeki Hikaru|3 April 1943 – }} is the first female admiral of the [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]] (JMSDF) and the first female in the entire [[Japan Self-Defense Forces]] (JSDF) to achieve star rank. Originally a [[obstetrician]]-[[gynecologist]] with the degree of [[Doctor of Medicine|M.D.]],<ref name="讀報參考">{{Cite journal |page=p. 23 |journal={{lang|zh|读报参考}} |issue={{lang|zh|2016年第11期 总755期}} |date=11 April 2016 |script-title=zh:日渐活跃的日本女自卫官们 |language=zh-hans}}</ref> Saeki joined the JMSDF in 1989. After her service in several military hospitals and medical rooms aboard naval vessels, she became the first woman to head a JSDF hospital in 1997, promoted to [[Rear Admiral]] in 2001, and retired in 2003.
==Career== [[File:JSDF Central Hospital.JPG|thumb|left|JSDF Central Hospital, where Saeki served as a department director when she was promoted to Rear Admiral in 2001.]] A native to the Japanese prefecture of [[Gunma Prefecture|Gunma]],<ref name="現代日本人名錄">{{Cite book |script-title=ja:新訂現代日本人名録 2002 かな～せ |isbn=4-8169-1695-4 |date=28 January 2002 |publisher={{lang|ja|日外アソシエーツ株式会社}} |language=ja |page=1118}}</ref> Hikaru Saeki was born in 1943. Graduating from the [[Nippon Medical School]] in 1969, she worked at the [[Keio University|Keio University Hospital]] (as accoucheur) in [[Tokyo]]<ref name="讀賣">{{Cite news |language=ja |date=28 March 2001 |script-title=ja:自衛隊初の女性将官が誕生、佐伯光海将補 夫も元海将 |publisher={{lang|ja|[[Yomiuri Shimbun|読売新聞 東京朝刊]]}} |page= A. 39}}</ref> and the [[National Defense Medical College]] in [[Saitama Prefecture]].<ref name="現代日本人名錄"/> On April 1989, Saeki enrolled into the JMSDF as a physician, commissioned as [[Commander]] on August 1990,<ref name="艦船">{{Cite journal |script-title=ja:世界の艦船 |isbn= |issue={{lang|ja|2001年6月号 通巻583号}} |date=June 2001 |publisher={{lang|ja|海人社 }} |language=ja |page=p. 160}}</ref> then [[Captain (naval)|Captain]] in March 1992.<ref name="防衛年鑑">{{Cite book |script-title=ja:防衛年鑑 |isbn=9784938468231 |date=2002 |publisher={{lang|ja|防衛メディアセンター}} |language=ja |page=585}}</ref>
On November 1995, Saeki served as the Chief of Division for Research & Laboratory at the Department of Research & Laboratory, JSDF Central Hospital in Tokyo, then Director, Department of [[Gynaecology]] at the same hospital. She was assigned to [[Kyoto]] on December 1997 to take the post of Director, JSDF Hospital Maizuru.<ref name="防衛年鑑"/> For the first time, Japan had a woman in charge of a JSDF Hospital.<ref name="現代日本人名錄"/> On March 1999, Saeki was appointed as the Director of JSDF Hospital Sasebo in [[Nagasaki Prefecture|Nagasaki]], and reassigned back to the JSDF Central Hospital on December 2000, this time as its Director for Department of Rehabilitation Medicine.<ref name="防衛年鑑"/> On 27 March 2001, she was formally promoted to the rank of Rear Admiral by a personnel promotion announcement of Japan's Defense Agency (now [[Ministry of Defense (Japan)|Ministry of Dense]]),<ref name="讀賣"/> making her the first female flag officer of JSDF since its foundation in 1954.<ref name="現代日本人名錄"/> Saeki retired with that rank in 2003.<ref name="讀報參考"/>
{| class="infobox bordered" style="width: 35em; font-size: 90%; text-align: left; float:right;" cellpadding="3" |- ! colspan="2" style="background: #CFCFCF; text-align: center" {{!}} Annex: Major experience |- | colspan="2" style="font-size: 90%" |<div style="text-align: left"> *<small>April 1989: Enrolled into the JMSDF</small> *<small>November 1995: Chief of Division for Research & Laboratory, JSDF Central Hospital</small> *<small>August 1996: Director, Department of Gynaecology, JSDF Central Hospital</small> *<small>December 1997: Director, JSDF Hospital Maizuru</small> *<small>March 1999: Director, JSDF Hospital Sasebo</small> *<small>December 2000: Director, Department of Rehabilitation Medicine, JSDF Central Hospital</small> *<small>2003: Retired</small> |} Besides serving on several JSDF hospitals and medical rooms aboard JMSDF vessels, Saeki was highly praised for her effort on taking care of [[lifestyle disease]] during her career as a JMSDF officer.<ref name="讀賣"/> She also conducted the improvement of child care environment inside the Self-Defense Forces,<ref name="讀報參考"/><ref name="彩">{{Cite book |author={{lang|ja|自衛隊の謎検証委員会編}} |script-title=ja:知られざる自衛隊の謎 |publisher={{lang|ja|彩図社}} |date=October 2011 |page=133 |language=ja |isbn=4883928136}}</ref> it was under her proposal that the JSDF issued uniforms in the type of maternity dress to pregnant service members.<ref name="彩"/>
==Marriage== Hikaru Saeki married Seiji Saeki ({{lang|ja|佐伯聖二}}), who is also a former admiral in the JMSDF,<ref name="現代日本人名錄"/> serving as the Vice Chief of Staff, JMSDF and Commander in Chief, Self Defense Fleet. He retired in 1997 with the rank of [[Vice Admiral]], and was awarded the [[Order of the Sacred Treasure#3rd class, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon|Order of the Sacred Treasure, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon]] by the Japanese government in 2011.<ref>{{Cite news |date=18 June 2011 |script-title=ja:春の叙勲 中綬章以上と在外邦人、外国人叙勲の受章者一覧 |publisher={{lang|ja|[[Yomiuri Shimbun|読売新聞 東京朝刊 朝特Ａ]]}} |page= A. 31 |language=ja}}</ref> It is a rare case among the world's armed forces for a couple to become both flag officers.<ref name="讀賣"/>
